headline: P&G Recommends Stockholders Reject Mini-Tender Offer by Tutanota LLC
summary: CINCINNATI, September 02, 2025--The Procter & Gamble Company (NYSE:PG) today announced that it has been notified of an unsolicited "mini-tender" offer by Tutanota LLC (Tutanota) to purchase up to 500,000 shares of the Company’s common stock at a price of $128 per share. The offer is conditioned on, among other things, the closing price per share of P&G stock exceeding $128 on the last trading day before the offer expires. This means that unless this condition is waived by Tutanota, P&G sharehold

headline: 5 Stocks That Should Stay Stable in a Trump Economy
summary: President Donald Trump's second term has brought a lot of volatility in the stock market. Tariffs brought some uneasiness on what they would mean for stocks -- this had a major impact on the market....

headline: P&G (PG) Is Considered a Good Investment by Brokers: Is That True?
summary: Based on the average brokerage recommendation (ABR), P&G (PG) should be added to one's portfolio. Wall Street analysts' overly optimistic recommendations cast doubt on the effectiveness of this highly sought-after metric. So, is the stock worth buying?

headline: Procter & Gamble: Better Off Buying An ETF
summary: Procter & Gamble has significantly underperformed indexes, such as the S&P 500, across short, medium, and long-term periods. Read why PG stock is a Sell.
